Data science is more than machine learning.

For the past few years there has been intense debate about the definition of data science, who can call themselves data scientists, what tools data scientists should use, and what the job description of a data scientist actually entails.
This fluidity is part of what makes data science exciting to me. The field is always changing.
The specifics of data science can vary drastically by industry and even by company.
However, to me, the best definition of what a data scientist does is as follows:
This ‚Äúvalue‚Äù may be in automating a ML pipeline to create a product.
It may be in generating scientific insight and discovery.
But regardless of the industry, data scientists use state-of-the-art tools (i.e. programming languages, methodologies) to unlock the potential of their organization‚Äôs data.
You are only valuable as a data scientist if you in turn are creating value.

summary: With a passion for learning new technologies coupled with the desire to gain an in-depth understanding of data analytics, to help companies enable technology-driven business transformation, I am currently pursuing a master‚Äôs degree in Information Management at Syracuse University with specialization in Data Science.My prior experience working with Tata Consultancy Services as a SAP Business Intelligence Analyst has instilled in me strong analytical and problem-solving skills, which are my key strengths. Outside of academia, I love participating in and managing various student organizations which have equipped me with leadership skills in addition to grooming my personality. Being a self-motivated person with an inquisitive mind, the desire to learn, and explore new opportunities has always been a strong motivating factor for me.
